meta.id: know something or someone for what it/he/she is
stems: know something or someone for what he is
know something or someone for what it is
know something or someone for what it/he/she is
know something or someone for what she is

hwi.hw: know something or someone for what it/he/she is

dt: {bc}to understand what something or someone truly is

dt.t: Now I {it}know{/it} them {it}for what they are{/it}—liars.
before scientists {it}knew{/it} the disease {it}for what it is{/it}—a virus

shortdef: to understand what something or someone truly is

dt: {bc}to accept or allow something unpleasant or unwanted
usually used in the phrase {phrase}like it or lump it{/phrase}

dt.t: {it}Like it or lump it{/it}, the new law goes into effect today.

shortdef: to accept or allow something unpleasant or unwanted —usually used in the phrase like it or lump it

dt: used to say that one will not make a better offer than the offer one has made

dt.t: I'll give you $500 for the camera, but that's my final offer. {it}Take it or leave it{/it}.

dt: used to say that one does not care about or is not excited about something

dt.t: "Do you like lobster?" "I can {it}take it or leave it{/it}."

shortdef: —used to say that one will not make a better offer than the offer one has made
—used to say that one does not care about or is not excited about something
